unnormalised: ## Film Festivals: More Than Just Popcorn & Red Carpets!
normalised: ## Film Festivals: More Than Just Popcorn and Red Carpets!

unnormalised: Hey guys! So, you binge-watched everything on Netflix, Hotstar, and Prime? Feeling a little…blah? I get it. But let me tell you, there’s a whole other world of cinema out there, one that goes way beyond the usual Bollywood masala and Hollywood blockbusters. I'm talking FILM FESTIVALS!
normalised: Hey guys! So, you binge-watched everything on Netflix, Hotstar, and Prime? Feeling a little…blah? I get it. But let me tell you, there’s a whole other world of cinema out there, one that goes way beyond the usual Bollywood masala and Hollywood blockbusters. I'm talking FILM FESTIVALS!

unnormalised: Think of it as a mela for movie buffs. Seriously! Instead of jalebis and giant wheels, you've got indie films, documentaries that'll blow your mind, and Q&As with directors who are actually passionate about, you know, telling a story.
normalised: Think of it as a mela for movie buffs. Seriously! Instead of jalebis and giant wheels, you've got indie films, documentaries that'll blow your mind, and Q and A's with directors who are actually passionate about, you know, telling a story.

unnormalised: I recently went to the Jaipur International Film Festival (JIFF), and let me tell you, it was an experience. Forget the usual Dharma Productions fare (though I secretly love them!), I saw films from Iran, Argentina, even a short from Nagaland! They were raw, real, and totally different.
normalised: I recently went to the Jaipur International Film Festival (J I F F), and let me tell you, it was an experience. Forget the usual Dharma Productions fare (though I secretly love them!), I saw films from Iran, Argentina, even a short from Nagaland! They were raw, real, and totally different.

unnormalised: Plus, you get to meet some seriously cool people. I bumped into this filmmaker from Pune who was making a documentary about the dwindling population of Great Indian Bustards. Seriously, who knew?
normalised: Plus, you get to meet some seriously cool people. I bumped into this filmmaker from Pune who was making a documentary about the dwindling population of Great Indian Bustards. Seriously, who knew?

unnormalised: Film festivals aren’t just about watching movies either. There are workshops, panel discussions, and a chance to network with other film enthusiasts. I even saw Anupam Kher giving a masterclass at Whistling Woods International a while back. Now that was something!
normalised: Film festivals aren’t just about watching movies either. There are workshops, panel discussions, and a chance to network with other film enthusiasts. I even saw Anupam Kher giving a masterclass at Whistling Woods International a while back. Now that was something!

unnormalised: Okay, so maybe the red carpet at JIFF wasn't quite as glamorous as Cannes, but the chai breaks were definitely top-notch. And the samosas? *Chef's kiss*.
normalised: Okay, so maybe the red carpet at J I F F wasn't quite as glamorous as Cannes, but the chai breaks were definitely top-notch. And the samosas? *Chef's kiss*.

unnormalised: If you’re looking to expand your cinematic horizons and escape the usual Bollywood-Hollywood echo chamber, seriously consider checking out a film festival. Maybe next year I’ll see you at the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa?
normalised: If you’re looking to expand your cinematic horizons and escape the usual Bollywood-Hollywood echo chamber, seriously consider checking out a film festival. Maybe next year I’ll see you at the International Film Festival of India (I F F I) in Goa?

unnormalised: So, what are your favourite types of movies? Tell me in the comments! And have you ever been to a film festival? Let me know your experiences!
